# Auto-Generated Pages
AVAnnotate creates auto-generated web pages for each event. 

## Features of Published Auto-Generated Project Pages

A Home Page with a Table of Contents
![Image 1: ](../../assets/newautoimage1.png)

[Event](https://avannotate.github.io/documentation/pages/events/) pages with [timestamped annotations](https://avannotate.github.io/documentation/pages/annotations/), the event description, a media player, and a tags filter if [tags](https://avannotate.github.io/documentation/pages/tags/) have been included.
![Image 2: ](../../assets/newautoimage2.png)

An index of [Tags](https://avannotate.github.io/documentation/pages/tags/) if tags are included.  
![Image 3: ](../../assets/newautoimage3.png)

A sidebar navigation menu.
![Image 4: ](../../assets/newautoimage4.png)
![Image 5: ](../../assets/newautoimage5.png)

## Adding and Modifying Auto-generated pages
The list of "Auto-generated" pages is shown on the [Site Builder](https://avannotate.github.io/documentation/pages/site-builder/) tab on the backend. 
![Image 6: ](../../assets/newautoimage6.png)

Users can "Disable" or "Re-Enable" auto-generation for any `Event` and the home page. If auto-generation is disabled, editing the page will open a [custom blank page](https://avannotate.github.io/documentation/pages/custom/).  
![Image 7: ](../../assets/newautoimage7.png)

Users can create a new auto-generated page under the `Add Page` menu.
![Image 8: ](../../assets/newautoimage8.png)

## Reordering pages
Pages can be re-ordered using the three-dot settings either on the same level or by making a page a sub-page or a super-page. These changes will appear in the table of contents and side-bar menus of the published project.  
![Image 9: ](../../assets/newautoimage9.png)
